```{r}
library(dplyr)

```


```{r}
lagsort<- function(lagrow){
  a <- lagrow[1]
  b <- lagrow[2] 
  c <- lagrow[3] 
  d <- lagrow[4] 
  e <- lagrow[5]
  vec <- c(a,b,c,d,e)
  vec <- sort(vec, decreasing = FALSE) # so the are in increasing order 
  vec
}
```

now time for the basic tree model

```{r}
library(tree)
library(gbm)
library(randomForest)
```


```{r}
dhistree10 <- dhist10size %>% mutate(amount = unlist(amount))
dhistree <- dhistree10 %>% select(amount, skewc, varc, histavg, kurtc, is_female, d1, d10)
treebasic <-  tree(formula = amount ~. , data = dhistree)
summary(treebasic)
plot(treebasic)
text(treebasic ,pretty=0)
```

```{r}
treeboost = gbm(formula = amount ~ varc + histavg + skewc + kurtc + varc + is_female + d1 + d10, data = dhistree, distribution="gaussian",n.trees=1000, interaction.depth = 3)

m<- summary(treeboost)
m %>% 
  mutate(var = fct_reorder(var, rel.inf)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x= var, y = rel.inf)) + geom_bar(stat = "identity", color="steelblue", fill="white") +
  coord_flip() 
ggsave("relinf.png")


mean((yhat.boost - dhistree$amount)**2) #mse
yhat.boost=predict(treeboost, newdata=dhistree, n.trees=1000)

par(mfrow=c(1,2)) #can change shrinkage parameter (lambda) if want to 
plot(treeboost ,i="skewness") #maginal effect of the variable after integrating out the other variables 
plot(treeboost,i="histavg")
plot(treeboost,i="variance")
plot(treeboost,i=c(1,2,3), return.grid = TRUE)
plot(treeboost,i=c(1,2,3))
```

#add to the linear model 
```{r}
dhistree$treepred <- yhat.boost
reg <- lm(amount ~ treepred, data = dhistree)
summary(reg)
plot(reg)
```
